snippet: He's pro-Terrence Malick and anti-Woody Allen.
abstract: He's pro-Terrence Malick and anti-Woody Allen.
lead_paragraph: Anthony Bourdain, who will be a guest programmer on Turner Classic Movies on April 10, tells the Carpetbagger he's pulling for "The Tree of Life" and Gary Oldman at the Oscars, and hated, hated, hated "Midnight in Paris.''

headline.main: Anthony Bourdain Makes His Oscar Picks
